meanings.definition: A spoken or written repetition of a sound or syllable.
meanings.sent1: She heard a dit in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to practice saying the dit.
meanings.sent3: The dit of the clock was so loud, it made her giggle.
meanings.sent4: The dit of the bird's song echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The dit of the drumbeat set the rhythm for the dancers.

meanings.definition: A signal in Morse code consisting of a single dash.
meanings.sent1: The Morse code message included a dit at the beginning.
meanings.sent2: He tapped out the dit on the telegraph machine.
meanings.sent3: The dit in Morse code sounded like a secret code to the children.
meanings.sent4: The dit in the transmission was clear and strong.
meanings.sent5: The dit in Morse code was the key to unlocking the message.
